pull_request.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

update.description:
* Added option to import a floor plan to draw on top of

* Includes tool to help users scale the image (pixels to real world measures)

* Possible to import a different image for each level of the building

* `Hide` button to hide drawed items and reveal the image behind them

* Fixed bugs with adding/deleting levels and added `-` button
update.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

content.raw: I don't think `emit` is needed here. `gui::editor::Events::triggerHideEditorItems();` triggers the gazebo event.
content.html: I don't think emit is needed here. gui::editor::Events::triggerHideEditorItems(); triggers the gazebo event.

content.raw:
* An option to choose units is on the todo list ;)

* From meters to feet or the other way around? You mean you wrote the number but the height didn't change? Did you click `Apply`?
content.html:
• An option to choose units is on the todo list ;)

  • From meters to feet or the other way around? You mean you wrote the number but the height didn't change? Did you click Apply?

pull_request.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

pullrequest.title: Building editor: Import background image and improve add/delete levels

content.raw:
I did a user study already, but I've just noticed a couple of other small things in my testing:

* The units are all in m, but the floorplan I just imported uses feet. I used google to convert units manually. Could be room for something to aid in converting units.
* I used Google to convert the wall height from meters to feet, but I wasn't able to paste into the Wall Inspector height field.
content.html:
I did a user study already, but I've just noticed a couple of other small things in my testing:

  • The units are all in m, but the floorplan I just imported uses feet. I used google to convert units manually. Could be room for something to aid in converting units.
  • I used Google to convert the wall height from meters to feet, but I wasn't able to paste into the Wall Inspector height field.
